Row.Text: Use 130 [ICON_PEACE] Faith to purchase Synagogues (+2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith, +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing Buildings)
Synagogues
Synagogue
+10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing Buildings

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synagogue)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A synagogue is a Jewish house of prayer. Synagogues have a large hall for prayer (the main sanctuary), and may also have smaller rooms for study and sometimes a social hall and offices. Some have a separate room for Torah study, called the Beith Midrash (Sefaradi) ("House of Study"). Synagogues are consecrated spaces used for the purpose of prayer, Torah reading, study and assembly; however a synagogue is not necessary for worship. Halakha holds that communal Jewish worship can be carried out wherever ten Jews (a minyan) assemble. Worship can also be carried out alone or with fewer than ten people assembled together. However, Halakha considers certain prayers as communal prayers and therefore they may be recited only by a minyan. The synagogue does not replace the long-since destroyed Temple in Jerusalem.
Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Synagogues belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Use [ICON_PEACE] Faith to purchase Synagogues (+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, each Religion in the City adds +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture)
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Synagogues
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Synagogue
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]+10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing Buildings

However, Halakha considers certain prayers as communal prayers and therefore they may be recited only by a minyan. The synagogue does not replace the long-since destroyed Temple in Jerusalem.
